Nota 2 Resumen de las políticas contables importantes -
Base contable y presentación de los estadosfinancieros:Los estados financieroshan sido preparados segúnlos principios de contabilidad generalmente aceptados enlos Estados Unidos deAmérica y las normas internacionales de contabilidad.Dichos estados financierosse presen- tan de conformidad con lo estipulado en el Pronunciamiento sobre Normas de ContabilidadFi- nanciera (Statement of Financial Accounting Standards) No. 111,"Estadosfinancieros de las organizacionessin fines de lucro" (SFAS No. 111).En el SFASNo. 117 se estipula que los activos netos deberán clasificarsede conformidadcon las restricciones para donantes;no obstante,al 30 de junio de 1999y al 30 de junio de 1998no había activosnetos.

doc.abstracts: This annual report concerns the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID). During fiscal year 1999, two more countries ratified the ICSID Convention to become members of the Centre. Five of the cases pending before ICSID during the year had been brought to the Centre on the basis of the provisions of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) on the settlement of investment disputes. The authors have audited the accompanying statements of financial position of the ISCID (the Centre) as of June 30, 1999 and 1998, and the related statements of activities and cash flows for the years then ended. In all, the past year was one in which ICSID consolidated as the leading center for the resolution of investment disputes between states and foreign investors and for the dissemination of knowledge on arbitration and foreign investment law.
